result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Arroyo Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
** Pay Prosecution costs -(if any).

timeConds.notes: AS OF 8/8/16.  AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION. Stay is lifted.   CREDIT SINCE 7/5/16.  Huber allowed for employment and treatment..  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

For Ct 2 only - DIsmissed and read in.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail is stayed, Huber privileges allowed; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; pay prosecution costs, if any owed; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; credit for one day served if revoked.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 10/26/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Marry and by agreement of ADA Delgado the FPT of 7/17/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as deft is almost done w/counselling; reset to 8-26-15 at 8:45am.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 5/11/15 at 9am is rescheduled, as the deft is still in counseling for 60 more days; reset to 7/17/15 at 8:30am.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 4/2/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as the deft should complete counseling within the next 6 weeks; reset to 5/11/15 at 9am.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 1/27/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as the deft is still in counseling; reset to 4/2/15 at 1:15pm.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 12/17/14 at 9am is rescheduled, as the deft is not ready to enter a plea on that date; reset to 1-27-15 at 8:30am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft is in counselling.  FPT continued to 12/17/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 9/25/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled, to give deft time to complete counselling; reset to 11/4/14 at 8:45am.
With Atty Marry the FPT of 8/13/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled, as Atty Marry has not had the opportunity to get to the DA'S office to listen/view the surveillance tapes; reset to 9/25/14 at 8:45am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the case is almost resolved, needs to review video tape, will attempt to do so in the DA's office.  FPT continued to 8/13/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
with Atty Marry the FPT of 6/9/14 at 9:30am is rescheduled, as they are having a discovery issue with tapes; reset to 7-1-14 at 8:45am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 5/16/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 6/9/14 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.
Consent and order for substitution of attorney; Atty Philip Marry is substituted in place of Atty Angela Komp for deft.

Judge Bastianelli acting for Judge Wagner for today only.  Asst. D.A. Carli McNeill appeared for the State.   Atty. Angela Komp appeared with the DE, the reading is waived & a plea of not guilty is entered.  FPT 3-18-14 @ 1:15.  Clerk D. Smith.
with Atty Komp the ARGN of 1/30/14 at 8:15am is rescheduled, as the deft is unavailable; reset to 2/10/14 at 8:15am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Angela Komp. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on1-30-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
